docs.text: ( dreamworks skg ) running time : 2 hours starring robert duvall , tea leoni and elijah wood directed by mimi leder the first of the two asteroid movies coming out this year ( the second is the macho armageddon ) is actually a dull affair .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: elijah wood plays leo biederman , who during astronomy class discovers that a large asteroid is heading for earth .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: tea leoni plays a ( rather crap ) news reporter , jenny lerner , who soon discovers about this asteroid through a very long winded and boring way , and robert duvall plays the leader of a space crew , spurgeon tanner , who are planning to blow the asteroid out of the path of earth .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: also featuring is morgan freeman as the president , and maximilian schell and vanessa redgrave as jenny's father and mother .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: while many people will walk into the film expecting a big special effects fest with the asteroid blowing everything up ( as the trailers seem to promise ) , the film is actually more of a character study , if a very poor one .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the main problem is that there are too many characters in the film , and not enough time to explore them all .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: only the space crew are given any depth , jenny lerner , leo and the president are surprisingly 2d , and we never get to know these characters .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and because i couldn't care for them , i didn't really give a crap if the asteroid killed them or not .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the script by bruce joel rubin and michael tolkin is horribly simple , and never really makes any interesting statements .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: mimi leder , the former er director and director of the average the peacemaker ( 1996 ) , again directs in a ho-hum style , and never really gets any emotion out of a scene , which is a shame .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the cast are seemingly on autopilot , although tea leoni does gives a rather good performance , even if she acts a bit too dorky for her own good .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: she seems uncommonly stupid for a journalist .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: robert duvall is on autopilot with a underwritten role , he just seems to be in this film for the money .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: elijah wood , one of the best child actors working today , is surprisingly average , although his choice of roles lately haven't exactly been brilliant ( i . e .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: flipper , 1996 ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: his role is also vastly underwritten .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: morgan freeman , again , is utterly wasted with a ridiculously underwritten role .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: like duvall , he just seems to be in the film for the money .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the supporting cast are all o . k , none making much of an impression .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ok , so deep impact may have messed up character wise , but surely the special effects are good ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: well , yes and no .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: although the special effects should be impressive , with a massive tidal wave destroying new york , the special effects look like , well , special effects .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sadly , the waves looks like it's been drawn on computer , and doesn't look too good at all .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: surprising really , when the effects are done by industrial light & magic , who did the effects for the lost world and twister .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in the end , deep impact is a wasted opportunity .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: what could of been a moving movie with good effects turns out to be a dud in both characters and effects .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the 2 hours the film had could have been used to much greater effect .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: once again , dreamworks has churned out another average movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: let's hope armageddon is a bit better .
docs.label: negative
